body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install py-torch@1.8.1 % gcc@8.3.0

-- Building version 1.8.1
Could not find <path>/spack-src/third_party/gloo/CMakeLists.txt.
Did you run 'git submodule update --init --recursive
==> Error.
```

### Additional information

This issue only occurs on an air-gap system.  I cannot attached build logs.

### General information

I'm not sure how the installer is supposed to access these *third_party* sources.  Does spack have a way to provide these as externals?  Is anyone else trying to build `py-torch` on an air gap system?
title: Installation issue: py-torch fails to build on air-gap system
